dublin_core.dcvalue: Several hospitals in northern Hessen not having their own radiology departments want to run CT scanners with the goal of improving medical quality They requested co operation from the Radiological Institute in the Hardtwaldklinik I in Bad Zwesten Therefore a teleradiological network was developed which enables the exchange of radiological images and reports between 19 hospitals today An elementary requirement for this co operation is an efficient and functional computer infrastructure and verified co operation contracts The conception structure and development of the program as well as associated difficulties are presented and discussed from different perspectives in the light of the controversy among experts The results experiences and benefits gained in four years in which the teleradiological network of northern Hessen has been in place demonstrate the importance and possibilities of teleradiology as an element of telemedicine Teleradiology telediagnostics improves the quality of patient care in smaller hospitals located in less populated areas and present possibilities to optimize and integrate health care structures taking economic considerations into account
[Teleradiology--blessing or curse? 4 years routine in the North Hessia teleradiology data network].
